summary: This is an email chain between Assistant U.S. Attorneys discussing a New York Post article about Jeffrey Epstein and confirming that a letter was sent to attorneys Tein and Goldberger. It shows internal DOJ communication regarding media coverage of the Epstein case.

persons.name: Tein
persons.context: Recipient of a letter from the Assistant U.S. Attorney's office, mentioned in the email chain.

persons.name: Goldberger
persons.context: Recipient of a letter from the Assistant U.S. Attorney's office, mentioned alongside Tein.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Subject of the New York Post article referenced in the email, central figure in the case.

connections.description: Both are mentioned as recipients of a letter from the U.S. Attorney's office, suggesting they are attorneys involved in the same legal matter, likely related to Jeffrey Epstein.
Tein is identified as a defense attorney, and the context implies legal representation related to Epstein's case.
Goldberger is identified as a defense attorney, and the context implies legal representation related to Epstein's case.

events.title: New York Post Article Published
events.description: A New York Post article titled 'bid_to_bum_epsteinfilea' is published, prompting internal DOJ email discussion.

events.title: Letter Sent to Tein and Goldberger
events.description: The Assistant U.S. Attorney's office sends a letter to attorneys Tein and Goldberger, as confirmed in the email.

locations: 500 S. Australian Ave, Suite 400, West Palm Beach, FL 33401
keyFacts: Internal DOJ emails from July 21, 2008, discuss a New York Post article about Jeffrey Epstein.
A letter was sent by the U.S. Attorney's office to defense attorneys Tein and Goldberger on the preceding Friday (July 18, 2008).
The correspondence originates from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of Florida in West Palm Beach.
The email chain shows coordination and awareness of media coverage related to the Epstein case within the prosecution team.
